TopicTitle: How to get a licence on the forum(SOLVED)

Articles.Content:
Can someone help me out with add on licenceing on the forum. As I am stumped

Edited October 20, 2016 by Gamax19

It's more of a virtual/conceptual thing.

If you're an author, the actual action is to include the text file with the full license text in the .zip of your mod, and choose/display the license on the page you publish your mod on, when you post it (not full text, just the license name.).

Choosing which license to choose is covered in this thread.

If you're a user, it really doesn't concern you. If you're an author, the license is mostly to regulate who, how much, and under what conditions can copy from your work to include in their own. If you don't care, go with Public Domain and the entire license text is 'I release this work into public domain.' If you want to be more protective, browse the thread to pick something that catches your fancy.
